cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi (160 km) SE of Fort Lauderdale, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move northwest along the Florida east coast through Sunday, then turn north-northwest Monday, accelerating north-northeast toward the Carolinas and the southern Mid-Atlantic states (including Chesapeake Bay).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast near the South Carolina / southern North Carolina border

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Boca Raton to Volusia/Flagler County Line FL (Hurricane Warning); North of Ocean Reef to south of Boca Raton FL and Volusia/Flagler County Line to Ponte Vedra Beach FL (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida through New England, including Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds of 35–45 mph with gusts to around 50 mph possible Tuesday night into early Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above normal tides possible in upper Chesapeake Bay and its tidal tributaries.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could produce 2–5 inches with isolated 6 inches, creating flash and urban flooding in Baltimore area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous marine conditions on Chesapeake Bay (high waves, strong currents), possible short-fused tornadoes in rain bands, and port operation disruptions due to high water levels and winds.
